medical_history.chief_complaint: Progressive walking difficulties and severe spastic paraparesis.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient presented with a 5-month history of progressive walking difficulties associated with frequent falls. Symptoms were exacerbated in the right leg, leading to hospitalization.
medical_history.past_medical_history: The patient was born with a severe cyanotic heart malformation, comprising tricuspid valve atresia, pulmonary stenosis, and interauricular and interventricular septal defects. No cardiac surgery was performed due to pulmonary hypertension.
medical_history.family_history: Family history revealed PTEN hamartoma tumor syndrome (PHTS) in her mother, who had macrocephaly and underwent thyroidectomy for thyroid adenoma and bilateral mastectomy for breast cancer. The patient's younger sister had macrocephaly with cortical dysplasia and an intraorbital tumor requiring enucleation.
